Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
classy \classy\ adj. 1. having elegance or taste or refinement in manners or dress. Opposite of {styleless}. [informal]
Syn: posh, swish, stylish. [WordNet 1.5]
2. exhibiting refinement and high character. Opposite of {low-class} [informal]
Syn: high-class. [PJC]

classy adj : elegant and fashionable; "classy clothes"; "a classy dame"; "a posh restaurant"; "a swish pastry shop on the Rue du Bac"- Julia Child [syn: {posh}, {swish}] [also: {classiest}, {classier}]
